user_instruction: Rewrite the prompt to say exactly what your goal is, your level, and what equipment you have.
gold_prompt: Create a 4-week beginner workout plan for weight loss using only dumbbells. I can exercise 3 days a week for 30 minutes. Include a checklist to track my progress.
common_mistakes: Not saying if you want to lose weight or build muscle
Forgetting to say what equipment you have
Not saying how many weeks the plan should be
hint: Be specific about your goal and your tools.

scenario: You need a story for a contest.
user_instruction: Improve the prompt by adding details about the story's tone, length, and a surprise ending.
gold_prompt: Write a funny 500-word sci-fi story about a robot who wants to be a chef. The story must end with a surprise twist where the robot invents a new flavor. Keep it fun for kids.
common_mistakes: Asking for a story without a style or tone
Forgetting to say how long it should be
Not asking for a specific ending
hint: Define what a 'winning' story looks like.

scenario: You are planning a trip with friends.
user_instruction: Clarify the request by adding the destination, budget, and number of people.
gold_prompt: Plan a 2-day hiking trip for 4 adults near Denver. The budget is $200 per person. List the trails and where we should sleep.
common_mistakes: Forgetting to say how many people are going
hint: Give details so the model doesn't have to guess.

scenario: You have leftover food and want to cook.
user_instruction: Rewrite the prompt to list your ingredients and what kind of meal you want.
gold_prompt: Suggest 3 easy dinner recipes I can make using chicken, broccoli, and rice. I have 30 minutes. List the prep time for each.
common_mistakes: Not listing the food you have
Not saying what kind of meal (dinner)
Not saying how much time you have
hint: Tell the model exactly what you have.

scenario: You want to organize your closet.
user_instruction: Add details on how you want the items sorted.
gold_prompt: Create a guide to organizing a small closet. Separate clothes by season and color. Include a checklist of supplies like bins or hangers.
common_mistakes: Asking for help without saying what the goal is
Not saying how to organize it (by color, etc.)
hint: Describe how the closet should look when done.

user_instruction: Clarify the request by saying your level, music style, and practice time.
gold_prompt: Create a 1-month practice schedule for a beginner learning acoustic guitar. Focus on basic chords for pop songs. I can practice 20 minutes a day.
common_mistakes: Not saying what kind of guitar
Forgetting to say you are a beginner
Not saying how long the plan should be
hint: Be specific about time and skill level.

user_instruction: Rewrite the prompt to include what you bought, why you are returning it, and what you want.
gold_prompt: Write a polite email to support asking for a full refund for a broken blender (Order #12345). Explain that the motor broke. Ask for a shipping label.
common_mistakes: Not saying why you want a refund
Not saying if you should be polite or firm
hint: Give all the facts needed to help you.

scenario: You need a gift for a coffee lover.
user_instruction: Improve the prompt by adding your budget and what they like.
gold_prompt: Suggest 5 unique gift ideas for a coffee lover under $50. Do not suggest mugs or beans. Say why each is a good choice.
common_mistakes: Asking for ideas without a price limit
Not saying what NOT to buy (no mugs)
hint: Set limits to get better ideas.

scenario: You need to write a thank-you note.
user_instruction: Add who the note is for and what gift you got.
gold_prompt: Write a warm thank-you note to Aunt Sally for the scarf she knitted for my birthday. Mention that I love the blue color.
common_mistakes: Forgetting to say who it is for
hint: The model needs to know who and what.

scenario: You want to explain a game.
user_instruction: Add the name of the game and who you are explaining it to.
gold_prompt: Explain the rules of 'Capture the Flag' to a group of 10-year-olds who have never played. Focus on how to win and safety.
common_mistakes: Assuming the model knows the game
Explaining it too hard for kids
hint: Say the game name and the audience.

user_instruction: Ask the model to ask YOU questions to find the problem.
gold_prompt: My indoor fern is turning yellow. Ask me 3 questions about water and light to help find the problem.
common_mistakes: Asking for a fix without giving symptoms
Not asking the model to ask questions
Not saying what kind of plant it is
hint: Ask the model to interview you.

user_instruction: Add the subject, what to cover, and how much time you have.
gold_prompt: Create a 3-day study schedule for Biology. I need to cover chapters 5 through 9. I have 4 hours each day.
common_mistakes: Not saying how much to study
hint: Subject + Amount + Time.

user_instruction: Replace vague words with clear design terms.
gold_prompt: Check this poster design. Focus on making the headline stand out more from the background so it is easier to read.
common_mistakes: Using slang like 'pop' without explaining it
Not saying what part to change
Not explaining why to change it
hint: Use clear words instead of slang.

user_instruction: Tell the model to ask you about your home and life before suggesting a dog.
gold_prompt: I want a dog that fits my life. Ask me 5 questions about my home and free time to help me choose.
common_mistakes: Asking for a dog without giving info
Giving all the info at once instead of asking for questions
hint: Make the model ask you for details first.

scenario: You need a social media caption.
user_instruction: Add details about the photo and where you will post it.
gold_prompt: Write a fun Instagram caption for a photo of a dog playing in the snow. Include winter emojis.
common_mistakes: Forgetting to say what is in the photo
Not saying which app it is for
hint: Describe the photo.

scenario: You want a sports rule explained.
user_instruction: Add which rule and which sport.
gold_prompt: Explain the 'offside' rule in soccer to a beginner. Use a simple example.
common_mistakes: Assuming the model knows the sport
Asking about a rule without naming it
Not saying how simple the explanation should be
hint: Name the rule and the sport.

scenario: You need a special meal plan.
user_instruction: Add constraints for a vegetarian and peanut-free diet.
gold_prompt: Create a 7-day dinner menu that is vegetarian and peanut-free. Make sure ingredients are easy to find.
hint: Safety and diet are important rules.

user_instruction: Set rules: upbeat music only, no slow songs, no bad words.
gold_prompt: Make a 3-hour wedding playlist. Songs must be happy and fast. Do not include slow songs or songs with bad words.
common_mistakes: Asking regarding a playlist without a style
hint: Tell the model what to avoid.

scenario: You need to schedule a meeting.
user_instruction: Solve the problem: Busy Tuesday/Thursday, Office closed Friday. Find a time.
gold_prompt: Find 3 times for a 1-hour meeting next week. It cannot be Tuesday, Thursday, or Friday. Monday and Wednesday are open.
common_mistakes: Not saying how long the meeting is
Picking a day the office is closed
hint: Rule out the bad times clearly.

user_instruction: Add limits: price under $1000 and must be Windows.
gold_prompt: Suggest 3 laptops for a student. The price must be under $1000. Do not list Macs; I only want Windows.
common_mistakes: Not saying it is for a student
hint: Price and type are strict rules.

scenario: You need to write a complaint.
user_instruction: Set the tone to be serious but polite. No mean words.
gold_prompt: Write a complaint letter to my landlord about a leaking roof. Be serious but polite. Do not use mean or angry words.
hint: You can be firm without being rude.

user_instruction: Add rules: only 2 colors and describe it in text.
gold_prompt: Describe a simple logo for a bakery. Use only 2 colors: brown and white. Keep it simple.
common_mistakes: Not saying what business it is for
Expecting a picture instead of text
hint: Limit the colors to save money.

user_instruction: Solve the conflict: Kids want fun, parents want quiet. Find a middle ground.
gold_prompt: Suggest a family spot in San Diego that has fun for kids but also culture for adults. We want a place that isn't too loud.
common_mistakes: Ignoring the kids or the parents
hint: Find a choice that works for everyone.

scenario: You are asking for a raise.
user_instruction: Set rules: stick to facts and numbers, no feelings.
gold_prompt: Write an email asking for a pay review. Focus only on my 20% sales growth. Do not talk about my personal bills.
hint: Stick to the data.

user_instruction: Ask for a checklist grouped by food type.
gold_prompt: Make a shopping list for a taco party. Group items by section like Produce, Meat, and Dairy so it is easy to shop.
common_mistakes: Not saying what the party is for
hint: Think about the store aisles.

user_instruction: Ask for a specific format: Gratitude, Goal, Reflection.
gold_prompt: Write a template for my journal. Follow this order: 1. Gratitude (3 things), 2. Today's Goal, 3. Reflection.
common_mistakes: Not asking for the specific order
Not saying how many things to list
hint: Define the outline.

user_instruction: Ask for a table to compare price and features.
gold_prompt: Compare the Toyota Camry and Honda Accord. Make a table comparing Price, Gas Mileage, and Power.
common_mistakes: Asking for text instead of a table
Letting the model choose the format
hint: Tables are best for comparing.

user_instruction: Give a specific layout template.
gold_prompt:
Write text for my business card. Use this format:
[Name] | [Title]
----------------
[Phone] | [Email]
[Website]
common_mistakes: Asking for text without a layout
hint: Show the model exactly how it should look.

user_instruction: Ask for specific headers for Breakfast, Lunch, and Dinner.
gold_prompt: Create a 3-day meal plan. Use headers for 'Breakfast', 'Lunch', and 'Dinner' for each day. Include calories.
common_mistakes: Accepting a big block of text
hint: Headers make it easy to read.

scenario: You need to leave instructions for a pet sitter.
user_instruction: Ask for a numbered list in time order.
gold_prompt: Write instructions for my cat sitter. Make a numbered list in order: Morning, Afternoon, Evening.
hint: Lists are easier to follow.

user_instruction: Ask for a CSV format with Title and Author.
gold_prompt: Make a CSV list example for 3 books. Use these headers: Title, Author, Year, Genre.
common_mistakes: Asking for a list without commas
hint: CSV is a computer format.

user_instruction: Ask for a flyer with sections for Description, Location, and Contact.
gold_prompt: Write a 'Lost Phone' flyer. Include 4 sections: 'Description', 'Where Lost', 'Contact Info', and 'Reward'.
hint: Flyers need clear sections.

user_instruction: The model missed one ingredient. Rewrite the prompt to check ALL items.
gold_prompt: Double this recipe. Calculate 2x for every single item: 1 egg, 2 cups flour.
common_mistakes: Repeating the prompt without changing it
hint: Make sure it doubles everything.

user_instruction: The answer is wrong. Ask the model to show its work step-by-step.
gold_prompt: Solve 2x + 4 = 10. Show your work step-by-step to explain the math.
hint: Asking for steps helps catch errors.

user_instruction: What if the year is in the future? Add a rule for that.
gold_prompt: Calculate age from a birth year. If the year is in the future (like 2050), say 'Invalid Year'.
common_mistakes: Not saying what to do with bad dates
Assuming the model knows to flag it
hint: Tell it what to do with bad inputs.

user_instruction: The syllable count is wrong. Fix the prompt to check the count.
gold_prompt: Write a haiku about rain. Make sure it is exactly 5, 7, 5 syllables. Write the count next to each line.
common_mistakes: Asking for a haiku again without checking
Not asking the model to count
hint: Make the model prove the count.

user_instruction: There is a leftover penny. Tell the model who pays it.
gold_prompt: Split $100 among 3 people. Give the extra penny to the first person so it totals $100.00.
common_mistakes: Not saying who pays the extra
hint: Tell it how to handle the remainder.

user_instruction: The answer is boring. Ask for details like material and color.
gold_prompt: Write a product description for a running shoe. Mention the mesh material, neon color, and that it is for runners.
hint: Give the model facts to work with.

user_instruction: The model forgot the time zone. Tell it to check the time difference.
gold_prompt: Calculate the landing time in London for a flight from New York. Flight is 7 hours. Remember the +5 hour time difference.
common_mistakes: Assuming the model knows the time zone
Asking for length instead of time
hint: Time zones change the clock.

user_instruction: 'Sam' is taken. Ask for 3 other options.
gold_prompt: Create a username from 'Sam'. Since 'Sam' is taken, give me 3 variations using numbers (e.g., Sam_99).
common_mistakes: Not planning for it to be taken
Not saying how to change it
hint: Plan for the name to be busy.

user_instruction: It sorted by capital letters. Fix it to ignore case.
gold_prompt: Sort this list alphabetically: Apple, banana, Cherry. Ignore capitilization (treat 'b' and 'B' the same).
common_mistakes: Thinking it was a random mistake
Not seeing the capital letter issue
hint: Computers treat 'A' and 'a' differently.

user_instruction: The model guessed. Add the weather context.
gold_prompt: It is 45 degrees and windy. Should I wear a coat? Explain why.
hint: The model can't feel cold; tell it the temp.

user_instruction: Ask the model to double-check the dates.
gold_prompt: Write a bio of Abraham Lincoln. Verify and list his birth date, death date, and years of presidency to be sure they are right.
common_mistakes: Asking for bio without checking facts
Not saying which facts to check
Not asking for a list of facts
hint: History has lots of dates; check them.

user_instruction: Ask for history and risks, not a magic guess.
gold_prompt: Check historical weather for Seattle in June. Instead of a guess, give me the chance of rain based on history.
common_mistakes: Asking for a specific day too far away
Thinking the model can predict the future
hint: Long-term weather is about chances, not facts.

scenario: You are writing a cover letter.
user_instruction: Ask the model to grade its own work.
gold_prompt: Write a cover letter. Then, grade it 1-5 for being professional and clear. Suggest one fix.
common_mistakes: Not saying how to grade it
hint: Make the model be your editor.

user_instruction: Ask for proof and side effects.
gold_prompt: Is coffee good for you? summarize the science and mention one negative side effect.
common_mistakes: Not asking for the bad side
hint: Science usually has two sides.

user_instruction: Ask for a range (Low-High) and what is included.
gold_prompt: Estimate the cost of a wedding in Chicago. Give a Low, Medium, High range and list what assumption you made for guest count.
hint: Estimates are guesses unless you have rules.

user_instruction: Ask the model to check if the code works for screen readers.
gold_prompt: Write HTML for a 'Submit' button. Verify that it works for screen readers (has a label).
hint: Good code works for everyone.

user_instruction: Ask specifically for a warning to check official sites.
gold_prompt: Do US citizens need a visa for Japan? Add a warning that rules change and I should check the Embassy website.
common_mistakes: Trusting the model for legal advice
hint: Always check official rules.

scenario: You ask 'Why is the sky blue?'.
user_instruction: Make sure the answer is simple for a kid.
gold_prompt: Explain why the sky is blue to a 5-year-old. Check that you don't use big words.
common_mistakes: Not saying it is for a kid
Assuming the model knows the age
hint: Check the answer fits the audience.

scenario: You are writing a sales email.
user_instruction: Check if the email talks about the client's needs.
gold_prompt: Write a sales email for our software. Check: Does it talk more about the client's problems than our features? If not, fix it.
hint: Focus on the customer, not the product.

user_instruction: Ask the model to be exact.
gold_prompt: Quote the first part of 'The Raven'. Check that every word and comma is exactly right.
hint: Poetry needs to be exact.
